name: (1S)-4-[(3S)-2,2-Dimethylpentan-3-yl]-1-methyl-1H-2,3-benzodiazepine
Reason: 1,1-Benzene has a melting point of -169.2 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methyl group, a dimethylpentyl group, and a benzene ring. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and a slight increase in molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The dimethylpentyl group, with its increased molecular weight and rigidity, may contribute around +20 degrees Celsius. The benzene ring formation introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The methyl group and dimethylpentyl group can be estimated to add approximately +30 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity.
